newsitem.title: USA: Oracle seen as undervalued at Montgomery.
newsitem.headline: Oracle seen as undervalued at Montgomery.

text.p: Oracle Corp shares are undervalued, even though the software company's revenue is poised to take off because of major new products, Montgomery Securities' research director said Tuesday.

"Oracle's stock, on a valuation or price-earnings ratio, is at the lows of 1994," said Thomas Thornhill, head of Montgomery's technology research. "Oracle is right in front of a major product cycle with Oracle8."
Thornhill cited Oracle as an example of a solid technology company with lots of growth prospects whose stock has sunk because of recent heightened concerns about the stock market.

Oracle, the biggest publisher of database software, is scheduled in June to release a new version of its flagship product, Oracle8. The company also will release financial and manufacturing applications that work with Oracle8.
The new products are expected to boost Oracle's revenue growth.
In late afternoon trading, Oracle shares were down 3/8 at 39-1/2.

Other technology stocks favored by Montgomery include, Microsoft Corp, Seagate Technology Inc, Cisco Systems Inc, Fore Systems Inc and the stocks of semiconductor manufacturing equipment makers, Thornhill said.
